Package coreservlets

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AddressVerifier
    Given an e-mail address of the form user@host, connect to port 25 of the host and issue an 'expn' request for the user.
    Browser
    Very simplistic "Web browser" using Swing.
    EchoServer
    A simple HTTP server that generates a Web page showing all of the data that it received from the Web client (usually a browser).
    ExitListener
    A listener that you attach to the top-level JFrame of your application, so that quitting the frame exits the application.
    JIconButton
    A regular JButton created with an ImageIcon and with borders and content areas turned off.
    MailAddress
    Takes a string of the form "user@host" and separates it into the "user" and "host" parts.
    MultithreadedServer
    A template for a multithreaded server.
    NetworkClient
    A starting point for network clients.
    NetworkClientTest
    Make simple connection to the host and port specified.
    NetworkServer
    A starting point for network servers.
    NetworkServerTest
    Simple test of the NetworkServer parent class.
    SimpleEchoServer
    A simple HTTP server that generates a Web page showing all of the data that it received from the Web client (usually a browser).
    SocketUtils
    A shorthand way to create BufferedReaders and PrintWriters associated with a Socket.
    SplitTest
    Prints the tokens resulting from treating the first command-line argument as the string to be tokenized and the second as the delimiter set.
    TokTest
    Prints the tokens resulting from treating the first command-line argument as the string to be tokenized and the second as the delimiter set.
    UriRetriever
    Retrieve a URL given the host, port, and file as three separate command-line arguments.
    UrlParser
    Parses the input to get a host, port, and uri (file).
    UrlRetriever
    This parses the input to get a host, port, and uri (file), then passes these three values to the UriRetriever class to grab the URL from the Web.
    UrlRetriever2
    Read a remote file using the standard URL class instead of connecting explicitly to the HTTP server.
    UrlTest
    Read a URL from the command line, then print the various components.
    WebUtils  
    WindowUtilities
    A few utilities that simplify using windows in Swing.
